extracted-table.table-caption: Clinical, anatomical, and biological features of the three variants of PPA.

caption.p: Clinical, anatomical, and biological features of the three variants of PPA.

tr.td: Left inferior frontal gyrus and insula
Impaired retrieval and comprehension of low frequency single words, semantic deficits for objects and people, surface dyslexia/dysgraphia
Bilateral anterior temporal lobe, usually left>right
Word-finding difficulty, sentence repetition/comprehension deficits and phonological dyslexia/dysgraphia
Left inferior parietal lobule and posterior superior temporal gyrus

table-wrap-foot.p: AOS, Apraxia of speech; FTD, frontotemporal dementia; TDP-43, transactive response DNA-binding 43; AD, Alzheimer's disease.

extracted-table.transformed-table:
Table 1
Clinical, anatomical, and biological features of the three variants of PPA.
Primary progressive aphasia variantClinicalAnatomicalMost common pathology
Non fluent/agrammaticEffortful speech, AOS, dysarthria, agrammatismLeft inferior frontal gyrus and insulaFTD-4R tau
SemanticImpaired retrieval and comprehension of low frequency single words, semantic deficits for objects and people, surface dyslexia/dysgraphiaBilateral anterior temporal lobe, usually left>rightTDP-43-C
LogopenicWord-finding difficulty, sentence repetition/comprehension deficits and phonological dyslexia/dysgraphiaLeft inferior parietal lobule and posterior superior temporal gyrusADAOS, Apraxia of speech; FTD, frontotemporal dementia; TDP-43, transactive response DNA-binding 43; AD, Alzheimer's disease.
